title: England vs USA LIVE: Stream, time and latest updates from Rugby World Cup 2019 clash
text:
Follow the latest updates live from England’s second match at the Rugby World Cup as they take on the United States.

England made a winning start to their campaign against Tonga on Sunday, but the four-day turnaround between games has seen Eddie Jones rotate the side with 10 changes to the starting XV, although George Ford captains the side and Billy Vunipola is retained with Owen Farrell on the bench.

But the match will not be a walkover, with this being the strongest USA team to have reached a World Cup. With Premiership names such as Paul Lisike and Will Hooley, and captain Blaine Scully well known to Leicester Tigers fans, the USA will pose a good fight and could take full advantage of the short turnaround to spring a surprise inside the Kobe Misaki Stadium. Follow the live updates below.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Rugby World Cup latest news England vs USA starts at 11:45am BST

Eddie Jones makes 10 changes to starting line-up from win over Tonga

USA the last side to begin Rugby World Cup campaign

Welcome to The Independent's live coverage of today's Rugby World Cup clash between England and the United States, brought to you from pitchside at the Kobe Misaki Stadium. England are up and running at Japan 2019, though their 35-3 victory over Tonga last Sunday was hardly impressive and a big improvement will be needed as the tournament wears on. Eddie Jones has been keen to stress that this week, but he also knows that the four-day turnaround for today's match will require fresh legs, so a number of changes have been made to the starting line-up with the Australian making full use of his 31-man squad. USA meanwhile are preparing to make their World Cup bow as the final team to begin their campaign, having received a bye in round one of the pool stages. In truth, the US will be eyeing an upset against one of the big three and a win over Tonga in their pool stage to try and seal third place and automatic qualification for the 2023 World Cup - but who knows, this is the best US team to arrive at a World Cup and one that for the first time is fully professional. Kick-off is at 11:45am BST [7:45pm Japan Standard Time] so join us for all the build up ahead of the match.

When is it?

England vs United States takes place on Thursday 26 September at the Kobe Misaki Stadium.

What time does it start?

The match will kick off at 7:45pm Japan Standard time, which is 11:45am BST.

Where can I watch it?

The match will be shown live on ITV and ITV Hub from 11am.

Teams

England: Elliot Daly; Ruaridh McConnochie, Jonathan Joseph, Piers Francis, Joe Cokanasiga; George Ford, Willi Heinz; Joe Marler, Luke Cowan-Dickie, Dan Cole; Joe Launchbury, George Kruis; Tom Curry, Lewis Ludlam, Billy Vunipola.

Replacements: Jack Singleton, Ellis Genge, Kyle Sinckler, Courtney Lawes, Mark Wilson, Ben Youngs, Owen Farrell, Anthony Watson.

USA: Will Hooley; Blaine Scully, Marcel Brache, Paul Lasike, Martin Iosefo; AJ MacGinty, Shaun Davies; David Ainuu, Joe Taufete’e, Titi Lamositele; Ben Landry, Nick Civetta; Tony Lamborn, John Quill, Cam Dolan.

Replacements: Dylan Fawsitt, Olive Kilifi, Paul Mullen, Greg Peterson, Hanco Germishuys, Ruben de Haas, Bryce Campbell, Mike Te’o.
description: Follow the latest updates live from England’s second match at the Rugby World Cup as they take on the United States.
